description: L3 고급 문법 완성 - 잔여 16스테이지 (시제/가정법/관계사/담화 표현)

stages.title: 미래형 심화 (will vs be going to vs 현재진행형)
stages.intent: 다양한 미래 표현의 뉘앙스 차이를 이해하고 상황에 맞게 적절히 사용한다.
lexset: plan, intend, expect, predict, schedule, decide, promise, announce, forecast, arrange
traps: will vs be going to 의도/계획 구분

seeds.en: It's going to rain tomorrow.
I'm going to travel next week.
I will succeed someday.
I'm meeting a friend tonight.
It won't be easy.
I'm going to change the plan.
When is the meeting going to start?
They will arrive soon.
We're starting a new project.
The weather is going to get better.

stages.title: 과거완료 기본 (선행/완료)
stages.intent: 과거의 두 시점을 구분하여 먼저 일어난 일을 과거완료로 표현한다.
lexset: already, just, never, ever, before, after, until, since, by the time, finished

seeds.kr: 그가 도착했을 때 이미 회의가 끝나 있었습니다.
seeds.en: The meeting had already finished when he arrived.
I had bought tickets before the movie started.

seeds.kr: 그들은 전에 그곳에 가본 적이 없었습니다.
seeds.en: They had never been there before.

seeds.kr: 숙제를 다 했을 때 친구가 전화했어요.
seeds.en: My friend called when I had finished homework.
She said she had already had dinner.
I went out after the rain had stopped.
I had completed everything by 10 o'clock.
Had you read that book before?

seeds.kr: 우리가 도착했을 때 그들은 이미 떠났어요.
seeds.en: They had already left when we arrived.

seeds.kr: 그는 전에 그런 경험을 해본 적이 없었습니다.
seeds.en: He had never experienced that before.

stages.title: 과거완료진행형 (계속)
stages.intent: 과거 특정 시점까지 계속되던 동작이나 상태를 과거완료진행형으로 표현한다.
lexset: for, since, how long, until, by the time, still, working, studying, waiting, living

seeds.kr: 그가 올 때까지 2시간 동안 기다리고 있었어요.
seeds.en: I had been waiting for two hours when he came.
They had been living there for ten years.
I had been preparing for an hour before the meeting.
How long had you been studying English?
It had been raining since morning.

seeds.kr: 그녀는 3년 동안 그 회사에서 일하고 있었어요.
seeds.en: She had been working at that company for three years.
We had been meeting until lunch time.

seeds.kr: 그들은 왜 그렇게 오래 기다리고 있었나요?
seeds.en: Why had they been waiting so long?
He had been exercising since morning.

seeds.kr: 우리는 1주일 동안 그 문제를 논의하고 있었습니다.
seeds.en: We had been discussing the issue for a week.

stages.title: 조건문 심화 (2형/3형)
stages.intent: 현재 가정 상황과 과거 가정 상황을 구분하여 적절한 조건문을 사용한다.
lexset: if, unless, suppose, imagine, wish, regret, would, could, might, should

seeds.en: If I were rich, I would travel around the world.

seeds.kr: 만약 일찍 출발했다면 지각하지 않았을 거예요.
seeds.en: If I had left early, I wouldn't have been late.

seeds.kr: 시간이 있다면 당신을 도와줄 수 있어요.
seeds.en: If I had time, I could help you.
If I had known that, I would have told you.
If I had studied harder, I would have passed.

seeds.kr: 만약 날씨가 좋다면 피크닉을 갈 텐데요.
seeds.en: If the weather were nice, we would go on a picnic.

seeds.kr: 그 조언을 들었다면 실수하지 않았을 거예요.
seeds.en: If I had listened to the advice, I wouldn't have made mistakes.
What would you do if you were me?

seeds.kr: 만약 그 기회가 있었다면 잡았을 거예요.
seeds.en: If I had had the opportunity, I would have taken it.
If I were younger, I would try again.

stages.title: 관계대명사 심화 (that/which/who 정확한 구분)
stages.intent: 관계대명사의 제한적/비제한적 용법을 구분하고 쉼표 사용법을 익힌다.
lexset: who, which, that, whom, whose, where, when, why, person, thing

seeds.en: The person who I met yesterday was a teacher.

seeds.kr: 그 책은 매우 유명한데, 작년에 출간되었습니다.
seeds.en: The book, which was published last year, is very famous.
Students who learn English study hard.
This is what I was looking for.
Paris, which is my favorite city, is beautiful.
Who is the person that has the car keys?
That's the reason why I said it.

seeds.kr: 그들이 살고 있는 집이 매우 크네요.
seeds.en: The house where they live is very big.
I remember the day when we first met.
We should help people who need help.

stages.title: 관계부사 (when/where/why/how)
stages.intent: 시간, 장소, 이유, 방법을 나타내는 관계부사를 정확하게 사용한다.
lexset: when, where, why, how, time, place, reason, way, moment, situation

seeds.en: I remember the place where we met.
That's the reason why I was late.
Do you know when he left?
This is how I do it.
I miss the city where we lived.
What's the reason why they succeeded?
This is the hospital where I was born.

seeds.kr: 우리가 처음 만난 순간을 잊을 수 없어요.
seeds.en: I can't forget the moment when we first met.
That's how we solve the problem.
That's the school where I studied.

stages.title: 간접화법 확장 (시제 일치)
stages.intent: 간접화법에서 시제 일치 규칙을 정확히 적용하고 다양한 동사를 사용한다.
lexset: said, told, asked, explained, mentioned, admitted, suggested, promised, warned, complained

seeds.en: He said he would come tomorrow.
She said she had already done her homework.
The teacher told us to study hard.
They asked where I was.
He explained that he needed help.
She admitted that she had made a mistake.
The doctor advised me to take a rest.
They asked when the meeting was.
He promised that he would keep his promise.
She complained that she was too busy.

stages.title: 간접의문문 (I wonder/I don't know)
stages.intent: 의문사가 포함된 간접의문문의 어순과 시제를 정확히 구사한다.
lexset: wonder, know, remember, forget, understand, explain, tell, ask, question, curious

seeds.en: I wonder when he will come.
I don't know where they are.

seeds.kr: 이 문제를 어떻게 해결할지 생각 중이에요.
seeds.en: I'm thinking about how to solve this problem.

seeds.kr: 그가 올지 안 올지 확실하지 않아요.
seeds.en: I'm not sure if he will come or not.

seeds.kr: 왜 그런 일이 일어났는지 이해할 수 없어요.
seeds.en: I can't understand why that happened.
I want to know who did this.
Please tell me when it will finish.
I don't remember how much it costs.

seeds.kr: 어느 것이 더 좋은지 결정할 수 없어요.
seeds.en: I can't decide which one is better.
I wonder if they can succeed.

stages.title: 순서/결론 연결어 (First/Finally/Therefore)
stages.intent: 논리적 순서와 결론을 나타내는 연결어를 사용하여 체계적으로 의견을 전개한다.
lexset: first, second, next, then, finally, therefore, thus, so, consequently, in conclusion

seeds.en: First, we need to make a plan.
Then, we will put it into action.
Finally, we will check the results.
Therefore, this is the best choice.
In conclusion, we will succeed.
Second, we need to consider the budget.
As a result, everything changed.
The next step is to form a team.
Thus, we need to work harder.
Ultimately, we will achieve our goal.

stages.title: 조건부 조언 (If I were you)
stages.intent: 가정법을 사용하여 정중하고 효과적인 조언을 제시한다.
lexset: if I were you, suggest, recommend, advise, consider, try, avoid, better, should, would
traps: If I were you 고정 표현

seeds.en: If I were you, I would consult a doctor.

seeds.kr: 그 일을 다시 생각해보는 것이 좋겠어요.
seeds.en: I would reconsider that decision if I were you.
If I were you, I would wait a little longer.
I would recommend getting expert help if I were you.
If I were you, I wouldn't miss that opportunity.
I would be more careful with that decision if I were you.
If I were you, I would try a different approach.
I wouldn't worry about that if I were you.
If I were you, I would practice more.
I would accept that offer if I were you.

stages.title: 경험 공유 심화 (I've been to/I've never)
stages.intent: 현재완료를 사용하여 다양한 경험을 자연스럽게 공유하고 토론한다.
lexset: been to, visited, tried, experienced, seen, heard, met, done, accomplished, achieved
traps: have been to vs have gone to

seeds.en: I have been to Europe.
I have never tried that kind of food.
Have you ever seen that movie?
I have tried skydiving.

seeds.kr: 그들은 그런 경험을 해본 적이 없습니다.
seeds.en: They have never had such an experience.
He was the kindest person I have ever met.

seeds.kr: 그곳에 몇 번 가본 적이 있어요.
seeds.en: I have been there several times.
I have never heard of such a thing.
I have recently read an interesting book.
Have you ever learned that language?

stages.title: 강조 구문 (It is/was that)
stages.intent: 강조 구문을 사용하여 문장의 특정 부분을 효과적으로 강조한다.
lexset: it is, it was, that, who, when, where, what, emphasis, important, significant

seeds.en: It is exactly what I want.
It was he who did that work.
It was yesterday that I met them.
It was there that it happened.
It is this that is most important.
It was then that I understood.
It is for that reason.
It was she who won.
It is this method that is best.
It was at night that they arrived.

stages.title: 강조 부사 (really/actually/exactly)
stages.intent: 다양한 강조 부사를 사용하여 감정과 의견을 효과적으로 전달한다.
lexset: really, actually, exactly, absolutely, definitely, certainly, obviously, clearly, truly, indeed

seeds.en: That's really a good idea.
Actually, I don't think so.

seeds.kr: 정확히 그것이 제가 말하고 싶은 것입니다.
seeds.en: That's exactly what I want to say.
I absolutely agree.

seeds.kr: 확실히 더 나은 방법이 있을 거예요.
seeds.en: There's definitely a better way.
We will certainly succeed.
It was obviously a wrong decision.
I'm truly grateful.
It actually happened.
It's really an amazing result.

stages.title: 수량/정도 표현 심화 (plenty of/a bit)
stages.intent: 다양한 수량과 정도 표현을 상황에 맞게 정확하고 자연스럽게 사용한다.
lexset: plenty of, a bit, a little, quite, rather, fairly, extremely, slightly, considerably, enormous

seeds.en: We have plenty of time.
I'm a bit tired.
It's quite a difficult problem.
It seems rather expensive.
Quite a lot of people came.
I'm slightly worried.
There's an enormous amount of work.
That's a fairly fair proposal.
It's extremely important.
It has improved considerably.

stages.title: 의견 변경/정정 (On second thought/Actually)
stages.intent: 생각의 변화나 정정을 자연스럽고 정중하게 표현한다.
lexset: on second thought, actually, come to think of it, wait, correction, change mind, reconsider, realize
traps: come to think of it 용법

seeds.kr: 다시 생각해보니 그게 맞는 것 같아요.
seeds.en: On second thought, I think that's right.
Actually, I was wrong.

seeds.kr: 생각해보니 더 좋은 방법이 있을 것 같아요.
seeds.en: Come to think of it, there might be a better way.
Wait, that's not right.
Let me correct that - it was the day before yesterday, not yesterday.
I've changed my mind.
I'll reconsider it.
I realize now that I made a mistake then.
Oh, then that's a different story.
Then again, I'm not sure.
